bug.author: AcelisWeaven
bug.summary: Communicator not connecting when "Managed Stripping Level" is enabled
bug.description:
Describe the bug When "Managed Stripping Level" is set to Low/Medium/High (anything other than Disabled), the following error is shown when mlagents-learn is launched: <denchmark-code>UnityAgentsException: The Communicator was unable to connect. Please make sure the External process is ready to accept communication with Unity. at MLAgents.Batcher.SendAcademyParameters (MLAgents.CommunicatorObjects.UnityRLInitializationOutput academyParameters) [0x0002d] in <e4d88f720ac843b581fe7c0a306443b6>:0 at MLAgents.Academy.InitializeEnvironment () [0x00228] in <e4d88f720ac843b581fe7c0a306443b6>:0 at MLAgents.Academy.Awake () [0x00000] in <e4d88f720ac843b581fe7c0a306443b6>:0 </denchmark-code>
To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Go to Project Settings > Player Change the value of "Managed Stripping Level" to Low, Medium or High Build your project and run the training See error
Environment (please complete the following information):
OS + version: Windows 10, building for Linux ML-Agents version: ML-Agents v0.8 Environment: Custom (may not be relevant)

comments.comment:
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/AcelisWeaven>@AcelisWeaven</denchmark-link>
Thanks for bringing this issue to our attention.
I logged this as MLA-62 in our internal tracker. Are you OK with working around the problem in the meantime?
We probably need to define a link.xml to make sure these symbols aren't stripped. Docs <denchmark-link:https://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/ManagedCodeStripping.html>here</denchmark-link>

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/AcelisWeaven>@AcelisWeaven</denchmark-link> , This issue has been fixed by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Unity-Technologies/ml-agents/pull/2662>#2662</denchmark-link> , which was just merged to the develop branch. I am closing this issue, please reopen it if you still run into problems with code stripping in the future.
